description: From an unattested Norn word, from Old Norse eyrr. Compare Icelandic eyri, Norwegian øyr.

entries.meaning: A narrow bar of sand or gravel formed by the sea; a sandbank.

examples: It is precisely to this—not destruction, but dissolution—(for dissolve is the poet's word) this melting into thin ayre, of the world itself, that Tooke maintains the word rack, i. e. reek, to be most- appropriate. And I think he was right in so doing.
